name: aws-cloudwatch-log
label: AWS CloudWatch Log
description: AWS CloudWatch Log enables you to monitor, store, and access your system, application, and custom log files. This connector facilitates the automate operations related to the log group, log streams and metrics.

fields.title: Configuration Type
fields.name: config_type
fields.description: Type of configuration using which you will provide credentials to access AWS CloudWatch and perform automated actions. You can select between IAM Role or Access Credentials. If you select IAM Role, then enter details in the following field(s): AWS Instance IAM Role: IAM Role of your AWS instance to access AWS services. If you select Access Credentials, then enter details in the following field(s): AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS CloudWatch. AWS Access Key ID: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services. AWS Secret Access Key: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services.

AWS Instance IAM Role.title: AWS Instance IAM Role Name
AWS Instance IAM Role.name: aws_iam_role
AWS Instance IAM Role.tooltip: IAM Role Name of your AWS Instance where FortiSOAR installed, to access AWS services.
AWS Instance IAM Role.description: IAM Role Name of your AWS Instance where FortiSOAR installed, to access AWS services.

Access Credentials.title: AWS Region
Access Credentials.name: aws_region
Access Credentials.tooltip: AWS region of your account to access the AWS CloudWatch
Access Credentials.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS CloudWatch

Access Credentials.title: AWS Access Key ID
Access Credentials.name: aws_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services
Access Credentials.description: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services

Access Credentials.title: AWS Secret Access Key
Access Credentials.name: aws_secret_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services
Access Credentials.description: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. By default, this option is set as True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Create Log Group
operations.description: Creates a log group with the specified name. Validate log group creation at CloudWatch > Log Groups.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. This parameter is required if you have specified 'IAM Role' as the 'Configuration Type'. This parameter is optional if you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you choose'True', you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Log Group Name
parameters.description: The name of the log group.
parameters.name: logGroupName

parameters.title: KMS Key ARN
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CMK to use when encrypting log data.
parameters.tooltip: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Customer Managed Key(CMK) to use when encrypting log data.
parameters.name: kmsKeyId

parameters.title: Tags
parameters.description: Provide the key-value pairs to add the tags.
parameters.name: tags

operations.title: Create Log Stream
operations.description: Creates a log stream for the specified log group. Validate log stream creation at CloudWatch > Log Groups > Log Streams

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role

This parameter is optional if you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you choose'True', you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. parameters.title: Log Group Name
parameters.description: The name of the log group.
parameters.name: logGroupName

parameters.title: Log Stream Name
parameters.description: The name of the log stream.
parameters.name: logStreamName

operations.title: Get Log Groups List
operations.description: Lists the specified log groups. You can list all your log groups or filter the results by prefix of log group name.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. This parameter is required if you have specified 'IAM Role' as the 'Configuration Type'. This parameter is optional if you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you choose'True', you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Log Group Name Prefix
parameters.description: The log group name prefix to match.
parameters.tooltip: Prefix to match. e.g. For log group 'MySysLog', provide 'MySys'. If left blank, lists all the log groups
parameters.name: logGroupNamePrefix

parameters.title: Next Page Token
parameters.description: The token for the next set of items to return.
parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items returned. If left blank, the default is up to 50 items.
parameters.tooltip: Page size limit. If left blank, the default is up to 50 items.
parameters.name: limit

operations.title: Get Log Streams List
operations.description: Get lists the log streams for the specified log group. You can list all the log streams or filter the results by prefix.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. This parameter is required, if you have specified 'IAM Role' as the 'Configuration Type'. This parameter is optional if you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you choose'True', you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer

true.title: Role ARN

parameters.title: Log Group Name
parameters.description: The name of the log group.
parameters.name: logGroupName

parameters.title: Order By
parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The results to be ordered by the Log Stream Name or Event Time

LogStreamName.title: Log Stream Name Prefix
LogStreamName.description: The log stream name prefix to match.
LogStreamName.tooltip: Prefix to match. e.g. For log stream 'MySysLogStream', provide 'MySys'. If left blank, lists all the log groups
LogStreamName.name: logStreamNamePrefix

parameters.title: Next Page Token
parameters.description: The token for the next set of items to return.
parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items returned. If left blank, the default is up to 50 items.
parameters.tooltip: Page size limit. If left blank, the default is up to 50 items.
parameters.name: limit

operations.title: Get Log Events
operations.description: Get all the log events or logs for specific duration from the specified log stream. The log events entries are located at CloudWatch > Log Groups > Log Stream > Log Events

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. This parameter is required, if you have specified 'IAM Role' as the 'Configuration Type'. This parameter is optional if you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you choose'True', you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Log Group Name
parameters.description: The name of the log group.
parameters.name: logGroupName

parameters.title: Log Stream Name
parameters.description: The name of the log stream.
parameters.name: logStreamName

parameters.title: Start Time
parameters.description: The start of the time range for which log events to be fetched.
parameters.name: startTime

parameters.title: End Time
parameters.description: The end of the time range for which log events to be fetched.
parameters.name: endTime

parameters.title: Next Page Token
parameters.description: The token for the next set of items to return.
parameters.name: nextToken

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of log events returned.
parameters.tooltip: Page size limit. The default is set to 10 items.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.title: Oldest Logs First
parameters.description: If the value is true, the earliest log events are returned first. If the value is false, the latest log events are returned first. The default value is false.
parameters.tooltip: If the value is false, the latest log events are returned first. If you are using a previous nextForwardToken value as the nextToken then you must specify true.
parameters.name: startFromHead

operations.title: Delete Log Group
operations.description: Deletes the specified log group and it's associated archived log events permanently. Validate log group removal at CloudWatch > Log Groups.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. This parameter is required, if you have specified 'IAM Role' as the 'Configuration Type'. This parameter is optional if you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you choose'True', you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Log Group Name
parameters.description: The name of the log group is to be deleted.
parameters.name: logGroupName

operations.title: Delete Log Stream
operations.description: Deletes the specified log stream and it's associated archived log events. Validate log stream removal at CloudWatch > Log Groups > Log Streams.

operations.title: Update Log Retention Policy
operations.description: Sets retention policy that allows you to configure the number of days for which to retain log events in the specified log group.

parameters.description: Time period to retain the log events in the specified log group.

operations.title: Revert Log Retention Policy
operations.description: Reverts the retention of the specified log group. Log events do not expire if they belong to log groups without a retention policy.

operations.description: Uploads a batch of log events to the specified log stream

parameters.title: Timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp of log event

parameters.tooltip:
Choose date or provide epoch timestamp in milliseconds
 e.g 1633890600807

parameters.title: Message
parameters.description: Message of log event
parameters.name: message

parameters.title: Sequence Token
parameters.description: The sequence token obtained from the response of the previous upload call
parameters.name: sequenceToken
parameters.tooltip: The sequence token can be obtained using 'Get Log Streams List' operation or from the previous upload call

operations.title: Run Log Insight Query
operations.description: Schedules a query of a log group using CloudWatch Logs Insights for the specified log group and time range.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. This parameter is required, if you have specified 'IAM Role' as the 'Configuration Type'. This parameter is optional if you have specified 'Access Credentials' as the 'Configuration Type'. If you choose'True', you must specify the following parameters: AWS Region: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer Role ARN: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS. Session Name: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region
true.description: AWS region of your account to access the AWS Access Analyzer

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Log Group Names
parameters.description: The list of log groups to be queried.
parameters.name: logGroupNames
parameters.tooltip: List of log groups in CSV or list format. You can include up to 20 log groups.

parameters.title: Start Time
parameters.description: The beginning of the time range to query.
parameters.name: startTime

parameters.title: End Time
parameters.description: The end of the time range to query.
parameters.name: endTime

parameters.title: Query String
parameters.description: The query string to be used.
parameters.name: queryString

parameters.title: Limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of log events to be returned.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Page size limit. If left blank, the default is up to 1000 events.

operations.title: Get Log Insight Query Result
operations.description: Returns the results from the specified query.

operations.title: Stop Log Insight Query
